isis.stitle: SINGLE REDUCTION CARRIERS: ROCKWELL - DRIVER CONTROLLED MAIN DIFFERENTIAL LOCK - INSTALL CARRIER INTO AXLE HOUSING (WITH DIFFERENTIAL LOCK)

svcproc.title: INSTALL CARRIER INTO AXLE HOUSING (WITH DIFFERENTIAL LOCK)

svcprocinfo.para: Before using either the Air Pressure Method or the Manual Engaging Method to install the differential carrier into the housing, proceed with the following steps.

svcsubproc.title: Preparation to Install Differential Carrier Into Housing

step1.para: Clean the inside of the axle housing and the mounting surface where the carrier fastens. Use a cleaning solvent and rags to remove the dirt. Blow dry the cleaned areas with compressed air. Refer to CLEAN AND INSPECT.

warning.para: Be careful when using solvent. Follow the solvent manufacturers instructions for safe use to prevent injury.

step1.para: Inspect the axle housing for damage. If necessary, repair or replace the housing. Refer to CLEAN AND INSPECT.
Check for loose studs in the mounting surface of the housing where the carrier fastens. Remove and replace the studs where required.
Install the differential carrier into the housing. Use one of the following procedures.
Before the carrier is installed into the housing, install the right-hand axle shaft through the shift collar and into the side gear. (The axle shaft is being used as a spine alignment tool.)

note.para: A similar tool can be made from a damaged right-hand axle shaft by cutting off approximately 24 inches from the spline end.

step1.para: Align the splines of the shift collar and differential case half by rotating the axle shaft tool or drive pinion.

warning.para: Do not use your hands to hold the collar in position. Injury can result when air pressure is applied to the actuator.

step1.para: Connect an auxiliary air supply to the actuator assembly.
Apply and hold pressure to the actuator assembly. The air pressure will move the shift collar to engage the differential case half and lock the assembly.
If the shift collar has not moved the full distance on the splines of the differential case half, rotate the axle shaft tool or the drive pinion one complete rotation to the right or left.
Remove the axle shaft tool from the carrier.

note.para: Continue to hold the main differential in the locked (engaged) position with air pressure until the carrier is completely installed in the axle housing. If no air supply is available, use the Manual Engaging Method to lock (engage) the differential.

step1.para: Apply silicone gasket material to the mounting surface of the housing where the carrier fastens. Refer to APPLICATION OF SILICONE GASKET MATERIAL.
Install the carrier into the axle housing. Refer to INSTALL DIFFERENTIAL CARRIER INTO AXLE HOUSING, Steps 6 through 10.
Release the air pressure from the differential lock actuator and disconnect the auxiliary air supply.
Proceed to Step 9 of Manual Engaging Method.

Align the splines of the shift collar and the differential case half. This can be done by hand or by installing the right-hand axle shaft through shift collar and into the side gear. See Steps 1 and 2 of the Air Pressure Method.
Install the manual engaging capscrew into the threaded hole in the center of the cylinder cover.

Turn the manual adjusting capscrew to the right until the head of the capscrew is approximately 1/4 inch from the cylinder cover. DO NOT turn the capscrew beyond its normal stop. The capscrew is now in the service position and the main differential lock is completely engaged.

caution.para: There will be a small amount of spring resistance felt when you turn in the manual engaging capscrew. If a high resistance is felt before reaching the locked (engaged) position, STOP TURNING THE CAPSCREW, or the cover, fork and capscrew threads will be damaged.

step1.para: A high resistance on the capscrew indicates that the splines of the shift collar and the differential case half are not aligned or engaged.

Lift the shift collar as required and rotate to align the splines of collar and case half while you turn in the manual engaging capscrew. When the normal amount of spring resistance is again felt on the capscrew, the splines are engaged. Continue to turn in the manual engaging capscrew.
Install and fasten the carrier into the axle housing. Follow Steps 7 and 8 of the Air Pressure Method.
Remove the plug and gasket from their position.

note.para: When the manual engaging capscrew is removed from the service position in the actuator, the main differential lock becomes disengaged.

step1.para: Clean the plug, gasket, cylinder cover, and threaded hole in the center of the cylinder cover.
Install the plug and gasket into their operating position in the cylinder cover. Install the manual engaging capscrew into its storage position. See Figure 147.

figure.caption: Figure 147. Install Manual Engaging Capscrew into Storage Position

7. BOTTOM SIDE STORAGE HOLE FOR PLUG AND GASKET

step1.para: Tighten the plug to 44 to 55 ft-lbs. (60 to 75 N·m) torque. Tighten the manual engaging capscrew to 22 to 28 ft-lbs. (30 to 38 N·m).
Connect the vehicle air line to the differential lock actuator assembly.
Install the electrical connection on the sensor switch located in the carrier, below the actuator assembly.
Install the right and left-hand axle shafts. Refer to INSTALL AXLE SHAFTS.
Remove the jack stand from under the drive axle and lower the vehicle to the floor.
